Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CrusSp (S. paramamosain crustin, natural AMPs; Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: most common mud crabs in Asia (e.g. China),Scylla paramamosain

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: The recombinant peptide is active against Gram-positive bacteria such as A. viridans (MIC 0.625 uM) and M. luteus (MIC 0.312 uM). At 80 uM, not active against S-aureus (MIC >80 uM), S-haemolyticus, B-megaterium, Gram- S-thyphimurium, E-coli 363, E-cloacea, V-harveyi, K-pneumoniae.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: Rosetta (DE3) pLysS the vector, peptide synthesis in inclusion bodies as His-tagged fusion. Updated 12/2014; 11/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Imjongjirak C, Amparyup P, Tassanakajon A, Sittipraneed S.2009
Literature Information.Title: Molecular cloning and characterization of crustin from mud crab Scylla paramamosain
